channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bin store has build up of wooden pallets. Hover., 10th August
item.description:
Fly tipping in bin store at danny mccarthy court. Odessa street not been removed for months. Blocking access to recycling bins . And also dangerous. thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4A, Odessa Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Bollard down on refuge. Driver went over refuge., 10th August
item.description:
Once again the bollard is down on the refuge island. Driver went over refuge and knocked it down. This will cause same problems as earlier this year with major accidents and noise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes Road, New Southgate, London

item.title: Mattresses flytipped by bus stop, 10th August
item.description:
Mattresses and other stuff fly tipped next to bus stop by Cody Phillips estate agents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Widmore Road, Widmore, London

item.title: Large amounts of litter along the whole road, 10th August
item.description:
This matter has been reported numerous times. The whole right side of road as you go up Lodge Hill is covered with unsightly litter, dumped black sacks, bottles, cans etc. it is disgusting. The road is split between London Borough of Bexley and Greenwich council
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lodge Hill, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and Fly Tipping, 10th August
item.description:
There are items which have been dumped outside of 17 Franklin Place, these include a divan bed/mattress, old fence posts/panels/slats and cardboard/carpet. There has been a habitual problem with poor rubbish disposal at the end of this street, particularly in relation to the HMOs. It would be appreciated if something could be done to remedy the situation. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Franklin Place, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside at the etrance of a dental practice 207 Kilburn High Road, 10th August
item.description:
The pavement is uneven and seems to be sinking, this is right at the entrance of a dental practice where patients old and young have to walk over it to enter the practice; this could be serious hazard and serious accident likely to happen This requires urgent attention.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two Boris bikes and a toddler’s vehicle, 10th August
item.description:
They are being left in Tilson Close all the time. They have been there for at least a week. They are being used and stored there. Obviously they block both the roads and the pavements.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tilson Close, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Back garden of Nisbet house, 10th August
item.description:
Possibly used baby wipes and things in bag ? Happy to have cleared up other litter but not sure if some excrement in the bags so would be grateful if this could be cleared It’s on the back wall in front of the railway track in the right hand flower bed

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches causing issues with parking and accessing car, 10th August
item.description:
Since growth this spring and summer, tree branches on tree directly in front of no. 22 are hanging very low down, over part of the road, making parking difficult and making it hard to get a child in and out of car seat as branches get in the way of car door when open.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balgowan Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish all down the back alley left there, 10th August
item.description:
The rubbish has been here for some time and is causing loads of flies everywhere
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sutherland Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The hornbeam tree on the road has been losing huge amounts of debris, 10th August
item.description:
The tree has caused huge amounts of debris over drives, pavement and the road over the last 2 weeks. We ( neighbours) have had to fill up our green waste bins to contain some of this. The tree desperately needs pruning to get it to a good size and to hopefully minimise the mess it’s creating. The street cleaning has not been around since this began. It is also self seeding in my gravel drive. I’m wondering if it’s the right tree for a road but it certainly needs cutting back whatever the decision.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light pollution emanating from Hatherley Court, 10th August
item.description:
The floodlights which illuminate Hatherley Court at night cause light pollution to neighbouring residential buildings in Hatherley Grove and Westbourne Grove Terrace. The lights are unnecessarily bright, the light levels feel almost like daylight.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Hatherley Grove, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Veolia bins have not been emptied for weeks previous report records this as “fixed” as of 06.20 today. It is not fixed. Additionally someone has dumped loads of rubbish which is now spread over the pavement. Flies everywhere., 10th August
item.description:
Two veolia bins not been emptied for weeks. Who has the contract for these? A previous report is noted as fixed as at 06.20 today. It is not fixed. Additionally today someone has dumped domestic waste which is now spread over the pavement. Flies everywhere. This needs to be investigated by Greenwich council

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rocking pavement slab, 10th August
item.description:
Alley way leading to Ranworth close dangerous\rocking slab. The same area you fixed middle one now the far right side loose.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wessex Drive, North End, London
